paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper investigates the association of TTR gene variants c.76G>A and c.337‐18G>C with idiopathic small-fiber neuropathy (SFN). It concludes that these variants are not associated with SFN.

functional_data.summary: No evidence of amyloid deposition was found in skin or labial salivary gland biopsies.

variants.population_frequency: 7.27% in SFN cohort, 9% in control cohort, 5.14% in gnomAD.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence for likely benign classification.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is considered nonpathogenic based on the study's findings.
key_quotes: The c.76G>A and c.337‐18G>C TTR gene variants are not associated with SFN.
No amyloid deposits were found in the skin or labial salivary gland biopsy specimens of our SFN patients, suggesting that both the VOIs are benign or nonpathogenic.

functional_data.summary: No evidence of amyloid deposition was found in skin or labial salivary gland biopsies.

variants.population_frequency: 5.45% in SFN cohort, 8% in control cohort, 5.74% in gnomAD.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence for likely benign classification.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is considered nonpathogenic based on the study's findings.
key_quotes: The c.76G>A and c.337‐18G>C TTR gene variants are not associated with SFN.
No amyloid deposits were found in the skin or labial salivary gland biopsy specimens of our SFN patients, suggesting that both the VOIs are benign or nonpathogenic.

tables_processed.table_caption: Number of carriers and allelic frequencies for the two variants of interest.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
